definition: to do things each in one's own way
each/every
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
political/politics/government

sentences.english: They differed from each other in all aspects, from politics to language.
sentences.chinese: 它们不仅各自为政，连文字也不相同。

sentences.english: This means that work in both places is already running on an autonomous track.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着，这两个地方的工作已经是各自为政了。

sentences.english: But each of Beijing’s top 43 public schools is fiercely independent.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，北京最顶级的43所中学均各自为政。

sentences.english: You would also need to get turf-conscious departments to work together in mounting your counterattack.
sentences.chinese: 你还需要各自为政的各部门在你的反击战中相互合作。

sentences.english: Polis fragmented, non- unified monarchy, the war between the city-state.
sentences.chinese: 城邦各自为政，无统一君主，城邦之间战争不断。

sentences.english: Their own city , without a unified monarchy, between the city-state wars.
sentences.chinese: 城邦各自为政，无统一君主，城邦之间战争不断。

sentences.english: But each of Beijing's top 43 public schools is fiercely independent.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，北京前最著名的43所学校均各自为政。

sentences.english: In management co-ordination, incapable of market force.
sentences.chinese: 在经营上各自为政，无法形成市场合力。

sentences.english: The city-state does things their own way, the non-unification crowned head, between the city-state the war is unceasing.
sentences.chinese: 城邦各自为政，无统一君主，城邦之间战争不断。

sentences.english: To prevent the tendency to make decision arbitrarily and go their own way and oppose the defiance of orders and prohibitions.
sentences.chinese: 防止个人专断和各自为政，反对有令不行，有禁不止。

definition: each one does what he thinks is right (idiom)/each goes his own way
subordination/line of command
to pass the buck/to shirk responsibility
to set up an independent regime/to secede/segmentation/division/fragmentation
to act as one thinks fit/to have one's own way
internal friction/internal dissipation of energy (in mechanics)/fig. waste or discord within an organization
lit. like a sheet of loose sand/fig. unable to cooperate (idiom)
large tail obstructs action (idiom); bottom heavy/fig. rendered ineffective by subordinates
divide and rule (strategy)/divide and conquer
classification
(of a nation, government etc) demoralized/disunited
internal strife/power struggle/(of members of an organization) to fight each other
(of a warlord etc) to assemble one's personal army, thereby presenting a challenge to the central government
the name remains, but the reality is gone (idiom)
centralized power (history), e.g. under an Emperor or party
selfish departmentalism/departmental selfishness
